page.title: 01CHARTERS SCHOOL
page.content: Charters School is situated on the out skirts of Sunningdale.Before 1958 the land was used for grazing cattle.There are now 1296 pupils and about 80 staff at the school.166 are currently in the Sixth Form.'Charters'has a very good reputation for P.E.and apart from the usual facilities it has a Recreation Centre which is used by the local community.Charters is hoping to open up its doors to more handicapped people-at the moment it has 12.One unusual aspect of the school is that it part-owns a Residential Centre in Wales called Tirabad. Charters became comprehensive in 1970 and is considered to be a very happy place with no traditions-except for good teaching! The school crest is very unusual in that it depicts a shield within a shield containing a stag's head.
